member.name: T:Telerik.WebControls.ExpandEffect
member.summary: Defines the different visual effects that are applied when PanelItems are expanded or collapsed.
member.remarks: These effects are supported only on Internet Explorer for Windowstm.

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.ExpandEffect.None
member.summary: No expand effect is applied.

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.ExpandEffect.Barn
member.summary: Reveals new content of the object with a motion that resembles doors opening or closing.

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.ExpandEffect.Blinds
member.summary: Reveals new content of the object with a motion that appears to open or close blinds.

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.ExpandEffect.CheckerBoard
member.summary: Reveals new content of the object by uncovering squares placed like a checkerboard over the original content.

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.ExpandEffect.Fade
member.summary: Reveals new content of the object by fading out the original content.

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.ExpandEffect.GradientWipe
member.summary: Reveals new content of the object by passing a gradient band over the original content.

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.ExpandEffect.Inset
member.summary: Reveals new content of the object diagonally.

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.ExpandEffect.Iris
member.summary: Reveals new content of the object with an iris effect, similar to the opening of a camera aperture.

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.ExpandEffect.Pixelate
member.summary: Displays the content of the object as colored squares that take the average color value of the pixels they replace. This filtered display can be used as a transition.

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.ExpandEffect.RadialWipe
member.summary: Reveals new content of the object with a radial wipe, like a windshield-wiper blade.

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.ExpandEffect.RandomBars
member.summary: Reveals new content of the object by exposing random lines of pixels.

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.ExpandEffect.RandomDissolve
member.summary: Reveals new content of the object by exposing random pixels.

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.ExpandEffect.Slide
member.summary: Reveals new content of the object by sliding sections of the image into place.

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.ExpandEffect.Spiral
member.summary: Reveals new content of the object with a spiral motion.

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.ExpandEffect.Stretch
member.summary: Reveals new content of the object with a stretching motion to cover the original content. One option resembles a cube rotating from one face to another.

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.ExpandEffect.Strips
member.summary: Reveals new content of the object by moving successive strips into place, like a diagonal saw blade passing across the original content.

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.ExpandEffect.Wheel
member.summary: Reveals new content of the object with a rotating motion, like spokes of a wheel covering the original content.

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.ExpandEffect.Zigzag
member.summary: Reveals new content of the object with a forward and back motion that moves down the object.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.PanelItem.DataBind
member.summary: This method gets called during simple databinding.

div.para: The RadPanelbar allows you to use the simple data binding syntax to set any of the properties of the inline defined PanelItems during run time.

One more feature is the possibility of using this syntax in the contents of templates. Using the Container.Attributes["Name"] expression you can access the values of any properties or custom attributes defined for the PanelItem, which contains the template.
Don't forget to call Page.DataBind() to trigger the data binding.

example.code:
//ASPX Everything in one place:

<%# strWeekDay %>
<%# strDate %>
<%# strTime %>

The ID of this template's container is <%# Container.Attributes["ID"] %> //in code-behind private void Page_Load(object sender, System.EventArgs e) { Page.DataBind(); }

//ASPX Everything In one place:

<%# strWeekDay %>
<%# strDate %>
<%# strTime %>

The ID of this template's container is <%# Container.Attributes["ID"] %> //In code-behind Private Sub Page_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Page.DataBind() End Sub

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.PanelItem.Attributes
member.summary: Gets a name-value collection that holds all attributes of the PanelItem.
member.example:
Here the CustomTag attribute is added to the Attributes collection of the PanelItem, while the ID attribute is mapped to its ID property.
<PanelItems> <radP:PanelItem ID="Panel1" CustomTag="CustomValue"></radP:PanelItem> </PanelItems>
member.remarks: The collection includes both custom attributes and strongly typed attributes mapped to properties.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.PanelItem.ItemCollapsedCssClass
member.summary: Gets or sets the Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) class applied to the PanelItem if it is level 2 or above.
member.remarks: The class is applied to the TABLE tag of the item. You may set the property, which applies to the TD tag where the text of the item is rendered. If this property is not defined the PanelItem inherits the value of the or properties of its RadPanelbar container depending on its level.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadPanelbar.AutoPostBack
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a postback to the server automatically occurs when the user clicks on a PanelItem with no child PanelItems.
member.value: true if a postback to the server automatically occurs whenever the user clicks on a PanelItem; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadPanelbar.AutoPostBackOnExpandCollapse

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadPanelbar.CausesValidation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether validation occurs when the user clicks on a PanelItem.
member.value: true if validation occurs whenever the user clicks on a PanelItem; otherwise, false. The default is true.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadPanelbar.ValidationGroup

para.font: Note: This property is new in the .NET Framework version 2.0.

summary.para: Gets or sets the name of the validation group to which this validation control belongs.

member.value: The name of the validation group to which this validation control belongs. The default is an empty string, which indicates that this property is not set.
member.remarks: This property works only when CausesValidation is set to true.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadPanelbar.PostBackUrl

summary.para: Gets or sets the URL of the page to post to from the current page when a panel item from the panelbar is clicked.

member.value: The URL of the Web page to post to from the current page when a panel item from the panelbar control is clicked. The default value is an empty string, which causes the page to post back to itself.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadPanelbar.PersistStateInCookie
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Expanded state of PanelItems will be persisted between different pages in a cookie.
member.remarks: When this property is enabled RadPanelbar will try to save the changed expanded/collapsed state of its PanelItems in a cookie. If you use the property to navigate between multiple pages that contain a RadPanelbar make sure you use the same ID in all pages. If is true, this property is ignored.
member.value: true if the Expanded state of PanelItems is persisted between different pages in a cookie; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadPanelbar.ContentFile

member.remarks: If you do not specify an XML content file you may still programmatically create a RadPanelbar.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadPanelbar.Enabled

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadPanelbar.RightToLeft
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the content direction will be Right-to-Left.
member.remarks: If no direction is specified, the direction from the container of the RadPanelbar is applied.
member.value: true if Right-to-Left content direction is used; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadPanelbar.SingleExpandedPanel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether an expanded panel is collapsed when another panel at the same level is expanded.
member.value: true if an expanded panel collapses whenever another panel at the same level is expanded; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadPanelbar.FullExpandedPanels
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the currently expanded panel will occupy the whole empty space in the RadPanelbar.
member.remarks: If this property is set to true, then must also be set to true and must be set to a fixed pixel height. Otherwise is ignored. This property causes the level 1 subgroups to occupy the whole empty area or if they are bigger in height a scrollbar to appear. Also, if this property is taken in account all properties for level 1 PanelItems are ignored.
member.value: true if the currently expanded panel occupies the whole empty space in the RadPanelbar; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadPanelbar.ExpandEffect
member.summary: Gets or sets the visual effect that is applied when the PanelItems are expanded or collapsed.
member.remarks: This property applies globally to all PanelItems in the RadPanelbar. You can override this setting individually for every PanelItem with its property. This effect is supported only on Internet Explorer for Windowstm.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadPanelbar.ExpandEffectSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets the additional properties applied to the filter supplied in the ExpandEffect property.
member.remarks: The properties must be separated with semicolon and be in the form name=value. For example: "duration=0.5;orientation=vertical"

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadPanelbar.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the RadPanelbar control.
member.value: A Unit that represents the width of the RadPanelbar. The default is Unit.Empty
member.remarks: The width may be defined both in fixed pixels or as a percentage.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadPanelbar.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the RadPanelbar control.
member.remarks: The height may be defined both in fixed pixels or as a percentage.
member.value: A Unit that represents the height of the RadPanelbar. The default is Unit.Empty.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadPanelbar.SpaceBetweenPanelItems
member.summary: Gets or sets the space in pixels between the level 1 PanelItems.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadPanelbar.BeforeClientPanelItemExpanded
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the client-side JavaScript function that is called before a PanelItem is expanded.
member.remarks: The JavaScript function that will handle this event must have one parameter, which is a reference to the client-side PanelItem object being expanded. If the JavaScript function returns false the expanding of the PanelItem is cancelled.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadPanelbar.AfterClientPanelItemExpanded
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the client-side JavaScript function that is called after a PanelItem is expanded.
member.remarks: The JavaScript function that will handle this event must have one parameter, which is a reference to the client-side PanelItem object being expanded. If the JavaScript function returns false, no redirection to the value of the expanding PanelItem would occur even if the property is set.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadPanelbar.BeforeClientPanelItemCollapsed
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the client-side JavaScript function that is called before a PanelItem is collapsed.
member.remarks: The JavaScript function that will handle this event must have one parameter, which is a reference to the client-side PanelItem object being collapsed. If the JavaScript function returns false the collapsing of the PanelItem is cancelled.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadPanelbar.AfterClientPanelItemCollapsed
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the client-side JavaScript function that is called after a PanelItem is collapsed.
member.remarks: The JavaScript function that will handle this event must have one parameter, which is a reference to the client-side PanelItem object being collapsed. If the JavaScript function returns false, no redirection to the value of the collapsing PanelItem would occur even if the property is set.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadPanelbar.BeforeClientPanelItemClicked
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the client-side JavaScript function that is called before a PanelItem is clicked.
member.remarks: The JavaScript function that will handle this event must have one parameter, which is a reference to the client-side PanelItem object being clicked. If the JavaScript function returns false the clicking of the PanelItem is cancelled.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadPanelbar.AfterClientPanelItemClicked
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the client-side JavaScript function that is called after a PanelItem is clicked.
member.remarks: The JavaScript function that will handle this event must have one parameter, which is a reference to the client-side PanelItem object being clicked. If the JavaScript function returns false, no redirection to the NavigateUrl value of the PanelItem would occur even if the property is set.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadPanelbar.ClientMouseOver
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the client-side JavaScript function that is called when the mouse moves over the PanelItem.
member.remarks: The JavaScript function that will handle this event must have one parameter, which is a reference to the client-side PanelItem object which is hovered by the mouse.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadPanelbar.ClientMouseOut
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the client-side JavaScript function that is called when the mouse moves out of the PanelItem.
member.remarks: The JavaScript function that will handle this event must have one parameter, which is a reference to the client-side PanelItem object from which the mouse moves out.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadPanelbar.OptimizeForDisabledJavaScript
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the RadPanelbar is rendered in a way that is compatible with browsers with disabled JavaScript.
member.value: true if the RadPanelbar is rendered for browsers with disabled JavaScript; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadPanelbar.PreloadLiteralID
member.summary: Gets or sets the ID of the asp:Literal control where any JavaScript preload code for the images used in the RadPanelbar will be rendered.
member.remarks: It is best to put this control in the HEAD tag of the page.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadPanelbar.AppendDataBoundItems
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether existing PanelItems in the RadPanelbar should be cleared when binding to a data source.
member.value: true if existing PanelItems are removed whenever the user binds to a data source; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadPanelbar.DataSource
member.summary: Gets or sets the source containing the values used to populate the PanelItems within the RadPanelbar.
member.remarks: Use the property to specify the source of values to bind to a RadPanelbar control. Allowed types for the data source are DataTable, DataSet, DataView, and XmlDocument.
member.value: The default value is null (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadPanelbar.DataMember
member.summary: Gets or sets the table name from a DataSet if the assigned DataSource is a DataSet.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadPanelbar.DataFieldID
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the column that will be used to set the ID property of the PanelItems.
member.remarks: Since RadPanelbar is a hierarchical control, when binding to a data source (DataTable, DataSet, DataView) two columns that contain the ID and the parent ID for each PanelItem must be defined using the and properties.

example.code: Dim OldDbCon As New OleDbConnection("Provider=Microsoft.Jet.OLEDB.4.0;Data Source=" + Request.MapPath("Panelbar.mdb") + ";User ID=;Password=;") Dim adpPanelBar As New OleDbDataAdapter("SELECT * FROM Panelbar", OldDbCon) Dim dsPanelBar As New DataSet adpPanelBar.Fill(dsPanelBar) RadPanelbar1.DataFieldID = "ID" RadPanelbar1.DataFieldParentID = "ParentID" RadPanelbar1.DataSource = dsPanelBar RadPanelbar1.DataBind()

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadPanelbar.DataFieldParentID
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the column that will be used to indicate the ID of the parent PanelItem.
member.remarks: Since RadPanelbar is a hierarchical control, when binding to a data source (DataTable, DataSet, DataView) two columns that contain the ID and the parent ID for each PanelItem must be defined using the and properties.

example.code: Dim OldDbCon As New OleDbConnection("Provider=Microsoft.Jet.OLEDB.4.0;Data Source=" + Request.MapPath("Panelbar.mdb") + ";User ID=;Password=;") Dim adpPanelBar As New OleDbDataAdapter("SELECT * FROM Panelbar", OldDbCon) Dim dsPanelBar As New DataSet adpPanelBar.Fill(dsPanelBar) RadPanelbar1.DataFieldID = "ID" RadPanelbar1.DataFieldParentID = "ParentID" RadPanelbar1.DataSource = dsPanelBar RadPanelbar1.DataBind()

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadPanelbar.DataFieldParentRootValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the ParentID field that will be treated as a "no parent" value, making the record with this value a level 1 PanelItem.
member.remarks: By default this value is null, which means records with a null value in their ParentID column will be rendered as level 1 PanelItems.
member.value: The default is null (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.name: T:Telerik.WebControls.RadPanelbar.RadPanelbarClickEventHandler
member.summary: Represents the method that will handle the , and events of the RadPanelbar control.

remarks.para: When you create a delegate, you identify the method that will handle the appropriate event. To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate.

member.param: The source of the event.
A that contains the event data.

member.name: T:Telerik.WebControls.RadPanelbar.RadPanelbarPanelItemDataBoundEventHandler
member.summary: Represents the method that will handle the event of the RadPanelbar control.

remarks.para: The event is raised whenever a PanelItem is databound.

When you create a delegate, you identify the method that will handle the event. To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate.

member.param: The source of the event.
A that contains the event data.
